shows.title: An Alien Future / Open Lines
shows.first_half: Filmmaker and UFO researcher Dean Alioto joins guest host Ryan Wrecker (email) to delve into the true definition of disclosure and what it will look like in the future. Alioto will contemplate the future of mankind and the possibilities of joining a community of advanced non-human intelligences, exploring both the advantages and disadvantages of this brave new era. Followed by Open Lines in the latter half. Give Ryan a call and discuss whatever is on your mind!

shows.title: Mindset Shift / Financial Miracles
shows.first_half: Joining Ryan Wrecker (email), entrepreneur Joel Steele will discuss the lessons he learned when he was bankrupt and in jail. He'll explain how he then built a business in fitness, finance, and pro sports, and how he exceeded all the aspects of his life by embracing a simple mindset shift anyone can adopt. Followed by author Jim Paris, who shares his story of being well-off one minute, broke the next, and then receiving the divine to make things right. He'll teach us all how to pray for a financial miracle.
shows.second_half: 6-10pm PT: Art Bell - Somewhere in Time returns to 1/26/99 when Patrick Roy Mooney spoke about terminator seed technology.

shows.title: Astrological Cycles / Understanding Dreams
shows.first_half: First Half: Astrologer Mark Lerner joins Ryan Wrecker (email) to discuss the astrological forces shaping both our personal lives and the world at large, with a focus on what the current and upcoming planetary cycles reveal about humanity’s next chapter.
shows.second_half: Second Half: Bonnie Buckner, PhD is founder and CEO of the International Institute for Dreaming and Imagery. She'll explain her belief that dreams are maps that can guide us in solving our challenges and in receiving messages. She'll share how many people's lives have been changed through dream work and how to understand what’s going on while dreaming, even in nightmares.

shows.title: De-Stressing Methods / Ufology News
shows.first_half: First Half: Author and leadership expert Amy Leneker will speak about stress and its effects on people’s lives. She'll introduce her signature "Un-Stressing Method" and show us how success doesn’t have to cost your joy, your health, or your weekends. Leneker will help us get rid of unwanted stress and be a little more relaxed.
shows.second_half: Second Half: Advocate, researcher, and ufologist Danny Sheehan will discuss the latest in ufology and present the status of exactly how close we are to full disclosure.

shows.title: Natural Remedies / The Paranormal & Life-After-Death
shows.first_half: First Half: Pharmacist Ben Fuchs will address the many ways we can use natural remedies to help with ailments and health issues in addition to using modern medicine. He believes that supplementation and natural remedies are essential when it comes to everyday health.
shows.second_half: Second Half: Producer, director, writer, and author Paul Davids will discuss his story of discovering a very strange family photo from 1940 after his mother’s death, as well as his documentaries about such subjects as life after death, and how paranormal phenomena continued in his life throughout the years he was making those films.

shows.title: Renewable Energy Breakdown / Personal Empowerment
shows.first_half: First Half: Steve Goreham is the Executive Director of the Climate Science Coalition of America. He'll discuss how the AI revolution is driving up electrical power usage in the US and may destroy Net Zero energy policies as we head into what he believes will be a "renewable energy breakdown." He'll also critique the prevailing narrative around man-made climate impacts.
shows.second_half: Second Half: Author and happiness expert Michele Phillips will share her method to help us take control of our lives. She'll offer tools to empower ourselves, and help us discover how to navigate our emotions, thoughts, and beliefs.

shows.title: Pearl Harbor Revelations / Staying Young
shows.guests: T. Martin Bennett, Dr. Tony Youn
shows.first_half: First Half: As we near the 84th anniversary of the Pearl Harbor attack, author T. Martin Bennett will share the story of Mitsuo Fuchida, the pilot that was hand-picked by Admiral Yamamoto to lead the attack. Martin will bring us the account of Jake DeShazer, a furious airman wanting revenge on Japan, and the Covell family, whose daughter did the unthinkable that transformed Mitsuo Fuchida’s life.
shows.second_half: Second Half: Holistic plastic surgeon, Dr. Tony Youn, will discuss techniques for staying young before considering plastic surgery. He'll also talk about the many botched plastic surgeries that have taken place.

shows.title: Ghost Hunting & Movie Business / Open Lines
shows.guests: R.A. Mihailoff, Rick McCallum, Open Lines
shows.first_half: Stuntman Rick McCallum and actor R.A. Milhailoff (both members of the Hollywood Ghost Hunters) will discuss their careers in the movie making business. They'll bring us their unique perspective from being on the inside and reveal what it takes to do a stunt, portray a character, and make a good movie. They'll also delve into the many adventures they've had being members of the Hollywood Ghost Hunters. Followed by Open Lines in the latter half. Give George a call and discuss whatever is on your mind!
